what-it-does: Check for chained boolean operations that can be simplified.
why-is-this-bad: Refactoring the code will improve readability for these cases.
example:
a = int(input())
b = int(input())
c = int(input())
if a < b and b < c:
    pass



Use instead:


a = int(input())
b = int(input())
c = int(input())
if a < b < c:
    pass

example-split.example-before:
a = int(input())
b = int(input())
c = int(input())
if a < b and b < c:
    pass
example-split.example-after:
a = int(input())
b = int(input())
c = int(input())
if a < b < c:
    pass
